title: FPS always at 60 even though limit is "uncapped", help?
body:
Title^
My FPS used to be around 120 - 144 or so and then one day it sticks at 60 and never reverts back. I've tried setting framerate limits and it doesn't work.
IDK if it has to do with my graphics card or not. I have an Intel built-in card and then a Nvidia GM 840. However I'm pretty sure a) I'm playing with the Nvidia instead of the Intel, and b) the Nvidia is capable of running at 144 FPS or higher.

I know 60 is a perfectly fine framerate to have but sometimes when the game lags out it goes to 10-20 FPS briefly; when the framerate was higher the lags would only decrease FPS to ~30-40. Also I want the higher framerate anyway.

Thank you!

replies.body: Hi there sorry for the late reply. This happened to me as well a couple months ago, I gave it a day or two then update my graphics drivers and my fps returned to normal, let me know if this helped you as well :)

Have you ensured that *Vertical Sync* is disabled in your in-game **VIDEO** settings? Additionally, if that didn't work or was already disabled, you may have the *Game DVR* feature inside the Windows Game Bar enabled. If you do, it can cause your FPS to cap, so I'd recommend disabling the feature using [**this guide.**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html)

Let me know if those steps caused any change.
